title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Cosmetic
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Cosmetic 

Products) (Amendment) Regulations 2024. 

(2) The Principal Regulations, the European Union (Cosmetic Products) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 512 of 2015), the Regulations of 2016 
and these Regulations may be cited together as the European Union (Cosmetic 
Products) Regulations 2013 to 2024.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european union (cosmetic products) (amendment) regulation 2024 (2) principal regulation european union (cosmetic products) (amendment) regulation 2015 (s.i no 512 2015) regulation 2016 regulation may cited together european union (cosmetic products) regulation 2013 2024

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means the European Union (Cosmetic Products) 
Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 440 of 2013); 

“Regulations of 2016” means the European Union (Cosmetic Products) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 317 of 2016); 

“Regulations of 2017” means the European Union (Cosmetic Products) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 297 of 2017).

text_raw:

inserting “or these Regulations” after “the EU Regulation” in each place where 
it occurs.

STEPHEN DONNELLY,

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Cosmetic Products) Regulations 
2013 to give effect to a number of Commission Regulations. These Regulations 
have the effect of— 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
Benzophenone-3 as a UV filter (Commission Regulation (EU) 2017/238 
of 10 February 2017), 

- accounting for amendments allowing the Commission, at the request of 
a Member State or on its own initiative, to adopt the necessary measures 
to determine whether or not a specific product or group of products falls 
within the definition ‘cosmetic product’ (Commission Regulation (EU) 
2017/745 of 5 April 2017), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
Methylisothiazolinone (M.I.) as a preservative in rinse-off products 
(Commission Regulation (EU) 2017/1224 of 6 July 2017), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the prohibitions in relation to 
HICC, Atranol and chloroatranol in cosmetic products (Commission 
Regulation (EU) 2017/1410 of 2 August 2017), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
non-nano Zinc Oxide as a colorant (Commission Regulation (EU) 
2017/1413 of 3 August 2017), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
peanut oil and hydrolysed wheat proteins in cosmetic products 
(Commission Regulation (EU) 2017/2228 of 4 December 2017), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
Methylene Bis-Benzotriazolyl Tetramethylbutylphenol (MBBT) and 
MBBT (nano) as UV filters (Commission Regulation (EU) 2018/885 of 
20 June 2018), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
Tagetes minuta and Tagetes patula extracts and oils and prohibitions in 
relation to Tagetes erecta (Commission Regulation (EU) 2018/978 of 9 
July 2018), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to Ophenylphenol 
sodium o-phenylphenate, potassium ophenylphenate and MEA o-phenylphenate as preservatives (Commission 
Regulation (EU) 2018/1847 of 26 November 2018), 

(OPP), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
Phenylene Bis-Diphenyltriazine as a UV filter (Commission Regulation 
(EU) 2019/680 of 30 April 2019), 

 
 
 
 
 [637] 7 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the prohibitions in relation to 
2-Chloro-p-Phenylenediamine and its sulfate and dihydrochloride salts 
when used as a substance in hair dye products, including eyebrow dye 
products, and eyelash dye products (Commission Regulation (EU) 
2019/681 of 30 April 2019), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
Climbazole as an anti-dandruff agent and as a preservative (Commission 
Regulation (EU) 2019/698 of 30 April 2019), 

- accounting for amendments to uniformly implement the prohibition of 
CMR substances as substances prohibited in cosmetic products and 
pertaining to restrictions in relation to the use of Trimethylbenzoyl 
diphenylphosphine oxide, Furfural and Polyaminopropyl biguanide 
(Commission Regulation (EU) 2019/831 of 22 May 2019), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
the use of three forms of titanium dioxide (nano), coated with either silica 
and cetyl phosphate, alumina and manganese dioxide, or alumina and 
triethoxycaprylylsilane as UV filters (Commission Regulation (EU) 
2019/1857 of 6 November 2019), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
Hydroxyethoxyphenyl Butanone (HEPB) as a preservative (Commission 
Regulation (EU) 2019/1858 of 6 November 2019), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
Salicylic acid, including use as a preservative and non-preservative use, 
and to uniformly implement the prohibition of CMR substances as 
substances prohibited in cosmetic products (Commission Regulation 
(EU) 2019/1966 of 27 November 2019), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the restrictions in relation to 
the use of 2-hydroxyethyl methacrylate (HEMA) and 11,14-Dioxa-2,9diazaheptadec-16-enoic Acid, 4,4,6,16-tetramethyl-10,15-dioxo, 2-[(2methyl-1-oxo-2-propenyl)oxy]ethyl ester (Di-HEMA Trimethylhexyl 
Dicarbamate or Di-HEMA TMHDC) in nail products (Commission 
Regulation (EU) 2020/1682 of 12 November 2020), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the prohibition in relation to 
the use of 1,2,4-Trihydroxybenzene, 2-[(4-Amino-2-nitrophenyl)amino]-benzoic acid and 4-Amino-3-hydroxytoluene from cosmetic 
products and restrictions in relation to the use of specific substances in 
hair dye products (Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/1683 of 12 
November 2020), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to use of Methoxypropylamino 
Cyclohexenylidene Ethoxyethylcyanoacetate as a UV filter in cosmetic 
products (Commission Regulation (EU) 2020/1684 of 12 November 
2020), 

- accounting for amendments to the prohibition and restriction of CMR 
substances and restrictions in relation to the use of titanium dioxide in 
face products, hair aerosol spray products, as a UV filter and as a 
colourant, the use of salicylic acid in body lotion, eye shadow, mascara, 

 
 8 [637] 

eyeliner, lipstick and roll-on deodorant, and removing a duplicate entry 
for Nickel bis(tetrafluoroborate) (Commission Regulation 2021/850 of 
26 May 2021), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the prohibition of the use of 
deoxyarbutin in cosmetic products and restriction on the use of 
Dihydroxyacetone in non-oxidative hair dye products and self-tanning 
products (Commission Regulation (EU) 2021/1099 of 5 July 2021), 

- accounting for amendments to uniformly implement the prohibition of 
CMR substances within the internal market (Commission Regulation 
(EU) 2021/1902 of 29 October 2021), 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the use of Methyl-Nmethylanthranilate in cosmetic products (Commission Regulation (EU) 
2022/135 of 31 January 2022, and 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to restrictions on the use of 
Benzophenone-3 and Octocrylene when used as UV filters in cosmetic 
products (Commission Regulation (EU) 2022/1176 of 7 July 2022), and 

- accounting for amendments pertaining to the use of certain substances 
that release formaldehyde in finished cosmetics products by lowering the 
threshold regarding the requirement to indicate the presence of 
formaldehyde on the label of such products and to change the specific 
label warning to “releases formaldehyde” (Commission Regulation (EU) 
2022/1181 of 8 July 2022). 

These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Cosmetic Products) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [637] 9 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR 
Le ceannach díreach ó
